title: News regarding PropCo REIT
story_body:
PropCo REIT Appoints New Senior Vice President of Asset Management

PropCo REIT (NYSE: PROP) announced today the appointment of Jennifer Martinez as Senior Vice President of Asset Management, effective January 15. Martinez will oversee the company's portfolio of retail and mixed-use properties across the Southeast region.

Martinez joins PropCo from Meridian Property Group, where she served as Director of Portfolio Management for five years. She brings over 15 years of experience in commercial real estate asset management and leasing. In her new role, she will report directly to Chief Operating Officer David Chen.

"Jennifer's extensive background in retail property management aligns well with our strategic objectives," said Chen in a statement. "Her expertise will be valuable as we continue to optimize our portfolio performance."

The appointment comes as PropCo maintains its focus on enhancing operational efficiency across its 142-property portfolio. The REIT currently manages approximately 18.2 million square feet of commercial space across 12 states.

In other company news, PropCo announced it will participate in the upcoming NAREIT REITweek conference in New York from February 26-28. CEO Michael Thompson and CFO Sarah Williams are scheduled to attend one-on-one investor meetings during the event. The company will not be making a formal presentation at the conference.

Additionally, PropCo unveiled its annual sustainability report, highlighting modest improvements in energy efficiency across its portfolio. The company reported a 3.2% reduction in common area electricity usage compared to the previous year, primarily through LED lighting upgrades at 22 properties. The REIT also expanded its recycling programs to an additional 15 locations.

"We remain committed to responsible property management practices," said Lisa Park, PropCo's Director of Sustainability. "These incremental improvements demonstrate our ongoing efforts to reduce our environmental footprint while maintaining cost-effective operations for our tenants."

PropCo REIT shares closed at $24.83 yesterday, up 0.4% for the day. The stock has traded in a range of $22.50 to $27.15 over the past 52 weeks. The company is scheduled to report fourth-quarter earnings on February 8.
